sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian city of Kharkiv comes under attack while Canada makes good on its promise and delivers the first of its Leopard 2 tanks to Zelensky's front line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Italy's Venice and Viareggio carnivals are back in full swing and are expected to attract tourists from all over the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More destruction in Kharkiv on Sunday after two Russian S-300 missiles struck Ukraine's second largest city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Rescuers rushed in to clear the rubble following the attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Five people were injured in the blasts. Meanwhile, Ukraine's defense minister, Oleski Reznikov, has assured Western allies that deliveries of long-range weapons won't be used to strike targets in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: allies that deliveries of long-range weapons won't be used to strike targets in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, he added the West's reluctance to send jets to help the country defend itself will result in more fatalities.

sentences.sentence: territory territory till the 1991 status but if we will have a procrastination or reluctant with the aircraft's platforms it will cost us more lives more blood of ukrainians despite the flow of western weapons to ukraine russia has in recent days claimed gains around war-ravaged Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This comes as the US announced a new 2 billion euro arms and munitions package for Ukraine on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Canada's Defence Ministry released footage of the first Canadian Leopard 2 tanks being loaded onto C-17 military planes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Back in Bakhmut, some of its remaining residents prayed for peace at a candlelight mass in the basement of the Golden Dome's Old Saints Church, while heavy fighting rages on in the northern parts of the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Iran's supreme leader has reportedly offered amnesty and a reduction in prison sentences for the tens of thousands of people detained amid nationwide anti-government protests. The move is part of a yearly pardoning marking the anniversary of the 1979 Islamic revolution. However, activists have dismissed Khamenei's decree and say it doesn't change anything. They are calling for all protesters to be released unconditionally. Authorities have yet to acknowledge how many people have been arrested in the crackdown following the death of Masa Amini in police custody last September.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Pakistan's former President General Perez Musharraf has died at age 79. The ex-leader, who seized power in a coup in 1999, died in Dubai after a long illness. Perhaps most famously, Musharraf supported the US-led invasion of Afghanistan after the 9-11 attacks despite domestic opposition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: From 2001, he served as Pakistan's president for seven years until he was defeated in 2008.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In 2016, Musharraf sought medical treatment in Dubai and never returned. He had been living in exile ever since.

sentences.sentence: Cyprus has voted, and the former foreign minister of the ethnically divided nation, Nikos Christodoulidis,

sentences.sentence: Festivities kicked off on the 4th of February with two days packed full of shows, concerts and sporting activities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Taking its inspiration from the city's rich history, the opening ceremony was held on the city's beachfront. The program for the year entitled Mysteries of Transition will bring together over 300 artists from 17 different disciplines. A glittering display along Venice's Grand Canal. The

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: opening show of the world-famous Venice Carnival kicked off on Saturday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Performers took to brightly lit floats and gondolas for the original Dreamers Parade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Thousands of spectators lined the banks and bridges of Italy's floating city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Take Your Time for the Original Signs is the title of this year's two-week event, which draws us inspiration from the stars.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While it was scaled back due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the ancient tradition which began in the 11th century is back in full swing and is set to attract tourists from all over the world. Moving east overland to the Tuscan city of Viareggio, another carnival is also in full swing. Born in 1873, the Carnevale di Vioreggio is deeply embedded in the city's culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As one of Italy's largest folk events, it is famed for its towering paper mache floats and symbolic masks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The European Commission has presented proposals to enhance the competitiveness of Europe's net zero industry

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: and support the fast transition to climate neutrality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Labelled as the Green Deal Industrial Plan, the scheme aims to help European companies operating in green industries remain competitive globally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The plan builds on previous initiatives and is widely regarded as a reaction to major green subsidy packages by other countries, especially the US's Inflation Reduction Act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Speaking in Brussels, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen avoided the notion of a tit-for-tat measure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We welcome this. This is good news.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We have since long argued that the fight against climate change is a must, a must for our planet, a must for our economic prosperity, and a must for our strategic independence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We are competitive. We need competition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: What we are looking at is that we have a level playing field in the global competition as well as a level playing field within the single market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This is for us so important.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: As far as funding goes, the European Commission is open to relaxing existing state aid rules temporarily.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But in the medium term, Brussels wants a new common fund.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Yet this idea has already caused a big backlash in European capitals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Many member states are against the idea of any kind of fresh money, preferring instead existing programs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On the other hand, the political opposition says it can't be done without it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In the funding, we see that it's basically old wine in new bottles. So we see that it's basically old wine in new bottles so we see that stuff like that was already spent for in repower the um the um ets uh revenues they are also now again spent and uh the corona fund is spent again so i'm not sure this will help us because we actually need to have, I think, additional money on the European level. So we need to discuss about where to get this additional funding from some kind of euro bonds. And this is crucial. Whether the European Commission's plan will see the light of day remains to be seen. It will be discussed by EU leaders at a summit next week, with a final decision expected in March.
